title: Ticket #4552: RPM should not include local configuration file
description: The RPM installs a /etc/condor/condor_config.local file. This precludes local configuration by the system administrator. Configuration action in this file should be moved to the global configuration.
remarks:
2014-Oct-17 12:52:40 by johnkn:
note: [41403] fixes the problem for condor_install, but I couldn't find the code that the RPM packager uses - unless it's condor_install? This (may) only be a partial fix.

2014-Nov-10 09:30:18 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: TJ's changes to the condor_install/condor_configure scripts look good. I approve those changes.

2014-Nov-10 09:43:41 by johnkn:
CODE REVIEW: Tim's changes to remove local config from the rpm/deb installers looks mostly ok to me. But the security czar should sign off having require_local_config_file = false.

2014-Nov-11 08:58:34 by bbockelm:
Hi,

To prevent repeating previous mistakes of the OSG (when we tried to do something similar, but not identical, a few years back):

What happens if the admin is currently using /etc/condor/condor_config.local and installs the upgrade? Does RPM move it to /etc/condor/condor_config.local.rpmsave?

Brian
